info.name: MediCare FHIR API
info.description:
# MediCare FHIR-based Electronic Health Records API

        ## Overview
        This API provides comprehensive access to healthcare data using the HL7 FHIR R4 standard with role-based access control.
        The API enables secure, interoperable exchange of healthcare information for electronic health records (EHR) systems.

        ## User Roles
        - **Admin**: Full access to all resources and administrative functions
        - **Practitioner**: Access to patient data and medical records with authorization controls
        - **Patient**: Access to their own medical records only
        - **Pharmacist**: Access to medication-related resources (where implemented)

        ## Authentication
        All API endpoints (except login and registration) require authentication using JWT.
        1. Obtain a token by calling `/api/auth/login`
        2. Include the token in the Authorization header: `Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN`

        ## Common Parameters
        - **Pagination**: 
            - `page`: Page number (1-based)
            - `limit`: Items per page
            - `sort`: Field to sort by
            - `sortDirection`: Sort order ('asc' or 'desc')
        - **Resource IDs**: Most endpoints require a resource ID or type in the path
        - **Search Parameters**: FHIR standard search parameters are supported for resource types

item.name: auth
item.description: Authentication endpoints for login, registration, and password management

item.name: users
Create a new user profile (Admin only)
Create a new user with associated FHIR resource (Admin only)
Regenerate access code for a user (Admin only)

item.description: User management endpoints for creating and managing user accounts

item.name: Get list of supported resource types
fhir
Get resources associated with the authenticated user
Get the Patient resource for the authenticated patient user
Get the Practitioner resource for the authenticated practitioner user

item.description: Generic FHIR resource operations and capabilities

item.name: Get the patient profile for the authenticated user
item.description: Retrieves the FHIR Patient resource that is associated with the currently authenticated user. The user must have the PATIENT role.

item.name: Get encounters for the authenticated patient
item.description: Retrieves all clinical encounters for the currently authenticated patient. Results can be filtered and paginated using query parameters.

item.name: Get observations for the authenticated patient
item.description: Retrieves all clinical observations (vital signs, lab results, etc.) for the currently authenticated patient. Results can be filtered and paginated using query parameters.

item.name: Get medications for the authenticated patient
Get all data for a specific patient
Register a new patient
item.description: Creates a new patient resource in the FHIR server. Typically used during the registration process.

item.name: Update demographics for the authenticated patient
Assign a healthcare provider to a patient
Get healthcare providers for a patient
Advanced search for patients with pagination and filtering
Search for patients
item.description: Search for patients using FHIR search parameters. Results are paginated and can be filtered by name, gender, birthdate, and other supported parameters.

query.description: Birth date in YYYY-MM-DD format (supports gt, lt, ge, le prefixes)

item.name: Get a patient by ID
item.description: Retrieves a specific patient resource by its ID. The user must have appropriate permissions to access the patient data.

item.name: Get the practitioner profile for the authenticated user
Get patients assigned to the authenticated practitioner
